name: Biology BS
overview: The Biology major is designed for students with a broad interest in biology who desire to pursue careers in a wide range of biological and related fields. It provides students with excellent background preparation for postgraduate training in medicine and other health sciences, in tracks leading to academic and public service careers in biology, in biological industries, and even in nonbiological careers such as business, agriculture, and law. Emphasis is on breadth of training to expose students to all levels of modern biology.

sections.title: Entry to the Major
sections.description: Transfer applicants to the Biology major with 90 or more units must complete the following introductory courses prior to admission to UCLA: one year of general biology with laboratory for majors, preferably equivalent to Life Sciences 7A, 7B, and 7C, one year of calculus, one year of general chemistry with laboratory for majors, and one semester of organic chemistry with laboratory. A second semester of organic chemistry or one year of calculus-based physics is strongly recommended but not required for admission.

sections.title: The Major
sections.description: Complete two courses from each of the following five principles, for a total of 10 courses.

requirements.title: 1. Evolution and Genetics
requirements.description: Select two courses. Note: Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 120 is not open for credit to students with credit for course 185.

requirements.title: 2. Information Flow
requirements.description: Select two courses. Notes: Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 120 is not open for credit to students with credit for course 185. Physiological Science 166 is not open for credit for Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 170. Microbiology, Immunology, and Molecular Genetics 100L and 101 must be taken together to satisfy requirement.

requirements.title: 3. Structure and Function
requirements.description: Select two courses. Notes: Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 120 is not open for credit to students with credit for course 185. Physiological Science 166 is not open for credit for Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 170. Microbiology, Immunology, and Molecular Genetics 100L and 101 must be taken together to satisfy requirement.

requirements.title: 4. Transformations of Energy and Matter
requirements.description: Select two courses. Note: Physiological Science 166 not open for credit for Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 170.

requirements.title: 5. Systems
requirements.description: Select two courses. Notes: Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 120 is not open for credit to students with credit for course 185. Physiological Science 166 is not open for credit for Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 170. Microbiology, Immunology, and Molecular Genetics 100L and 101 must be taken together to satisfy requirement.

sections.title: Special Programs
sections.description: The department offers several optional special programs.

requirements.title: Optional Programs and Specializations
requirements.description: Students may choose to pursue one or more of the following programs. These are not required for the major.

options.title: Field Biology
options.description: The department offers quarter-long programs of advanced courses in field biology. These programs focus on the biology of organisms living in their natural environments, emphasize independent student research projects, and take place at field sites away from the UCLA campus. Each program carries 16 units of course credit. To participate, students must enroll in all courses in the respective program. Participants are selected by personal interview.

options.title: Field Biology Quarter (FBQ)
options.description: The Field Biology Quarter involves some combination of the following courses.

options.title: Marine Biology Quarter
options.description: The Marine Biology Quarter includes some combination of the following courses.

options.title: Honors Program
options.description: An overall grade-point average of 3.4 and a 3.4 in the major are required for graduation with honors. Highest honors are awarded to majors who have a GPA of 3.6 overall and a 3.6 in the major at graduation and who have successfully completed Ecology and Evolutionary Biology 198A and 198B.

options.title: Computing Specialization
options.description: Majors may select a specialization in Computing by satisfying all the requirements for a bachelor’s degree in the specified major and completing the following courses.

options.title: Program in Computing
options.description: Complete the following three courses and Program in Computing 30 and 60:
